editions.title: There have been many Latin editions of Euclid’s Catroptrica, but I am not aware that any contain the medieval translation. The editions are listed by Pietro Riccardi, Saggio di una bibliografia Euclidea, 5 pts. (Bologna, 1887-1893), and by Ver Eecke, pp. xxxvi-xlvii. The latter : work contains a French translation of the Greek text.
P. Ver Eecke, L'Optique et la Catoptrique. Avec une introduction et des notes, Brugge 1938, xxxvi–xlvii.

literature: Busard – Folkerts (1992), Robert of Chester’s Redaction of Euclid, vol. I, 36ff.; J. L. Heiberg, Litterargeschichtliche Studien über Euklid, Leipzig 1882, 148–53; Heiberg’s Prolegomena to Euclidis Opera omnia, ed. J. L. Heiberg and H. Menge, vol. 7, Leipzig 1895, xliii–lv; A. Lejeune, “Les ‘Postulats’ de la Catoptrique dite d’Euclide”, Archives internationales d’histoire des sciences 2 (1949), 598–613; A. Lejeune, Recherches sur la catoptrique grecque, Brussels 1957, 112–136.

editions.title: Il Codice Atlantico di Leonardo da Vinci nella Biblioteca Ambrosiana di Milano (Milan, 1894-1904).
Les manuscrits de Léonard de Vinci, ed. Charles Ravaisson-Mollien, 6 vols. (Paris, 1881-1891)
N. Ferrero, “Leonardo da Vinci: Of the Eye. An Original New Translation from Codex D", American Journal of Ophthamology, Ser. 3, vol. 35 (1952), 507–521.

D. S. Strong, “Leonardo da Vinci on the Eye: The MS D in the Bibliothéque de l'Institut de France, Paris, Translated into English and Annotated with a Study of Leonardo’s Theories of Optics,” unpublished doctoral dissertation (UCLA, 1967).
J. P. Richter, The Literary Works of Leonardo da Vinci, end ed., vol. 1 (London, 1939).
E. MacCurdy, The Notebooks of Leonardo da Vinci, vol. 1 (New York, 1942).
Scritti scelti di Leonardo da Vinci, ed. Anna Maria Brizio (Turin, 1952)
Le prospettive e le ombre nelle opere di Leonardo da Vinci, ed. Amedeo Agostini (Pisa, 1954).

literature: On Leonardo’s MSS, see Kate T. Steinitz, Manuscripts of Leonardo da Vinci.Their History, with a Description of the Manuscript Editions in Facsimile (Los Angeles, 1948). The best work on Leonardo’s optics is Strong’s dissertation (cited above); see also W. Elsdsser, “Die Funktion des Auges bei Leonardo da Vinci,” Zeitschrift fiir Mathematik und Physik, historisch-literarische Abteilung 45 (1900), 1–6; O. Werner, Zur Physik Leonardo da Vincis, Erlangen 1910; D. Argentieri, “L’ottica di Leonardo,” in Leonardo da Vinci, Milan 1940, 405–436 (translated into English, New York, 1956); M. H. Pirenne, “The Scientific Basis of Leonardo da Vinci’s Theory of Perspective,” British Journal for the Philosophy of Science 3 (1952–1953), 169–85; V. Ronchi, “L’optique de Léonard de Vinci,” in Léonard de Vina et lexpérience scientifique au XVI* siécle (Paris, 1953), 115–120; K. D. Keele, “Leonardo da Vinci on Vision,” Proceedings of the Royal Society of Medicine 48 (1955), 384–390; A. M. Brizio, Razzi incidenti e razzi refressi (dal f° 94v ed altri del Codice Arundel) (III Lettura Vinciana, Vinci, Biblioteca Leonardiana, 21 Apr. 1963) (Florence, 1964); Keele, “Leonardo da Vinci’s Physiology of the Senses,” in Leonardo’s Legacy, ed. C. D. O'Malley (Berkeley, 1969), 35–56.

literature: On Leonardo’s MSS, see Kate T. Steinitz, Manuscripts of Leonardo da Vinci. Their History, with a Description of the Manuscript Editions in Facsimile (Los Angeles, 1948). The best work on Leonardo’s optics is Strong’s dissertation (cited above); see also W. Elsdsser, “Die Funktion des Auges bei Leonardo da Vinci,” Zeitschrift fiir Mathematik und Physik, historisch-literarische Abteilung, vol. 45 (1900), pp. 1-6; Otto Werner, Zur Physik Leonardo da Vincis (Erlangen, 1910); Domenico Argentieri, “L’ottica di Leonardo,” in Leonardo da Vinci (Milan, 1940), pp. 405-36 (translated into English, New York, 1956); M. H. Pirenne, “The Scientific Basis of Leonardo da Vinci’s Theory of Perspective,” British Journal for the Philosophy of Science, vol. 3 (1952-1953), pp. 169-85; Vasco Ronchi, “L’optique de Léonard de Vinci,” in Léonard de Vina et lexpérience scientifique au XVI* siécle (Paris, 1953), pp. 115-20; Kenneth D. Keele, “Leonardo da Vinci on Vision,” Proceedings of the Royal Society of Medicine, vol. 48 (1955), pp. 384-90; Anna Maria Brizio, Razzi incidenti e razzi refressi (dal f° 94v ed altri del Codice Arundel) (III Lettura Vinciana, Vinci, Biblioteca Leonardiana, 21 Apr. 1963) (Florence, 1964); Keele, “Leonardo da Vinci’s Physiology of the Senses,” in Leonardo’s Legacy, ed. C. D. O'Malley (Berkeley, 1969), pp. 35-56.
